suffix.label: Usage before and after user activation.

suffix.name: AdFrames.Aggregate
suffix.label: Includes resources loaded across all ad frames on a page.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame
suffix.label: Includes resources loaded for a single ad frame.

suffix.name: FullPage
suffix.label: Includes all resources loaded by the page.

suffix.name: NonAdFrames.Aggregate.Total
suffix.label: The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources except for those loaded in ad frames.

suffix.name: NonAdFrames.Aggregate.Total2
suffix.label: The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources except for those loaded in ad frames.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.PeakWindowedPercent
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows while the page is unactivated of an ad creative. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.PeakWindowedPercent2
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows while the page is unactivated of an ad creative. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems. This is measured whether the frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.PeakWindowStartTime
suffix.label: The start time of the 30 second window associated with the PeakWindowedPercent of the frame, relative to navigation start of the page. Measured in milliseconds. Frames with no CPU usage do not record a start time. This is recorded only when the page keeps forgrounded.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.PeakWindowStartTime2
suffix.label: The start time of the 30 second window associated with the PeakWindowedPercent of the frame, relative to navigation start of the page. Measured in milliseconds. Frames with no CPU usage do not record a start time.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.PercentUsage
suffix.label: The average load of an ad creative across the life of the page. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.PercentUsage2
suffix.label: The average load of an ad creative across the life of the page, up until the creative is removed from the page. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.TotalUsage
suffix.label: The total load of an ad creative across the life of the page. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 seconds.

suffix.name: AdFrames.PerFrame.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total load of an ad creative across the life of the page. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 seconds. This is measured whether the frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: Activated
suffix.label: Includes only creatives that have had a user gesture.

suffix.name: Unactivated
suffix.label: Includes only creatives without a user gesture.

suffix.name: AdFrames.Aggregate.TotalUsage
suffix.label: The total CPU usage across all ad frames on a page in its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds.

suffix.name: AdFrames.Aggregate.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total CPU usage across all ad frames on a page in its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: FullPage.PeakWindowedPercent
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows during the lifetime of the page. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems.

suffix.name: FullPage.PeakWindowedPercent2
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows during the lifetime of the page. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: FullPage.PeakWindowStartTime
suffix.label: The start time of the 30 second window associated with the PeakWindowedPercent of the page, relative to navigation start of the page. Measured in milliseconds. Pages with no CPU usage do not record a start time. This is recorded only when the page keeps foregrounded.

suffix.name: FullPage.PeakWindowStartTime2
suffix.label: The start time of the 30 second window associated with the PeakWindowedPercent of the page, relative to navigation start of the page. Measured in milliseconds. Pages with no CPU usage do not record a start time.

suffix.name: FullPage.PercentUsage
suffix.label: The average load of the page across its lifetime. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems.

suffix.name: FullPage.TotalUsage
suffix.label: The total load of the page across its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 minutes.

suffix.name: FullPage.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total load of the page across its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 minutes. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: NonAdFrames.Aggregate.PeakWindowedPercent2
suffix.label: The peak load over all 30 second windows during the lifetime of the page of all non-ad frame activity including that of the main frame. This is measured as percentage of a cpu core used and capped at 100% for multicore systems. This is measured whether a frame was in the foreground or not.

suffix.name: NonAdFrames.Aggregate.TotalUsage2
suffix.label: The total load of non-ad frames on page including the main frame across its lifetime. This is measured in milliseconds and capped at 10 minutes. This is measured whether a frame is in the foreground or not.
Usage before and after the page is interactive.

histogram_suffixes.name: CertificateTypeBRValidity
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.

suffix.name: BR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires after 2013-12-31, meaning that it should be in scope for the Baseline Requirement's key size requirements

suffix.name: NonBR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires on or before 2013-12-31

suffix.name: BR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires after 2013-12-31 and was issued on or after 2012-07-01, as judged by the notBefore, meaning that it should be in scope for the Baseline Requirement's key size requirements

suffix.name: NonBR
suffix.label: The *leaf* certificate of the chain expires on or before 2013-12-31 or was issued before 2012-07-01

histogram_suffixes.obsolete: These were temporary metrics intended to understand whether high/low resolution clocks adversely impact page load metrics. After collecting a few months of data it was determined that clock resolution doesn't adversely impact our metrics, and that these histograms were no longer needed.

suffix.name: BeginImplFrameToFinishImpl
suffix.label: The time from when the Impl frame is started to when Impl fram is ready.

suffix.name: ImplFrameDoneToSubmitCompositorFrame
suffix.label: The time from when the Impl frame is ready to the the time compositor frame is submitted.

suffix.name: SendBeginMainFrameToBeginMainAbort
suffix.label: The time from when the begin main frame is sent to when begin main is aborted.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame
suffix.label: The time from when the a compositor frame is submitted to the display compositor to when it is presented.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.BufferAvailableToBufferReady
suffix.label: The time from when the target framebuffer is available to when the GPU has finished drawing to it.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.BufferReadyToLatch
suffix.label: The time from when the target framebuffer is ready to be displayed to when the buffer is latched on for presentation.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.LatchToSwapEnd
suffix.label: The time from when the target framebuffer is latched on to when the swap ends.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.ReceivedCompositorFrameToStartDraw
suffix.label: The time from when a compositor frame is received to when it starts to draw.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.StartDrawToSwapStart
suffix.label: The time from when a compositor frame is started to draw to when it starts swap.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.SubmitToReceiveCompositorFrame
suffix.label: The time from when the a compositor frame is submitted to when it is received.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.SwapEndToPresentationCompositorFrame
suffix.label: The time from when the a compositor frame ends swap to when it is presented.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.SwapStartToBufferAvailable
suffix.label: The time from when the compositor frame starts to swap to when the target framebuffer becomes available.

suffix.name: SubmitCompositorFrameToPresentationCompositorFrame.SwapStartToSwapEnd
suffix.label: The time from when a compositor frame starts to swap to when it ends swap.

suffix.name: TotalLatency
suffix.label: The total time starting from BeginImplFrame to when CompositorFramePresentation is done.

suffix.name: Impl
suffix.label: Impl side invalidation initiated pending tree

suffix.name: BubbleDialogDelegateView

suffix.name: DialogDelegate

suffix.name: DialogDelegateView
suffix.label: Counts dialog boxes created using DialogDelegateView. These are a subset of those created with DialogDelegate.

histogram_suffixes.name: DiscardReason

suffix.name: Proactive
suffix.label: The browser proactively discarded a tab to avoid entering a memory pressure state.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 01/2020.

suffix.name: Urgent
suffix.label: The browser urgently discarded a tab because there was memory pressure.

suffix.name: 7OrMoreUsers
suffix.label: 7 or more users exist on device.

histogram_suffixes.name: DisplaySchedulerNotDrawReason

suffix.name: Identical

suffix.name: Reordered
suffix.label: Same addresses, in a different order.

suffix.name: disabled_prefetch
suffix.label: DNS pre-resolving is disabled in these clients

suffix.name: disabled_prefetch_4_connections
suffix.label: DNS pre-resolving is disabled in these clients, and a maximum of 4 connections per host was allowed

suffix.name: enabled_prefetch_4_connections
suffix.label: a maximum of 4 connections per host was allowed in these clients

suffix.name: parallel_4_prefetch

suffix.name: parallel_4_prefetch
suffix.label: with only 4 concurrent speculative resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_6
suffix.label: with only 6 concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_7
suffix.label: with only 7 concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_8
suffix.label: with only 8 concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_9
suffix.label: with only 9 concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_10
suffix.label: with only 10 concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_14
suffix.label: with only 14 concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_20
suffix.label: with only 20 concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: parallel_default
suffix.label: with the default number of concurrent resolutions done in parallel

suffix.name: AsyncPrivateSupportsDoh
suffix.label: using Chromium's resolver, with a DNS server that supports DNS-over-HTTPS

suffix.name: SystemPrivate
suffix.label: using the system resolver using private DNS

suffix.name: SystemSupportsDoh
suffix.label: using the system resolver, with a DNS server that supports DNS-over-HTTPS. Note that on Android the DNS servers are not passed to native code when private DNS is used so we cannot detect when private DNS is used with servers that support DNS-over-HTTPS, so this bucket will fall into the SystemPrivate bucket.

suffix.name: Other
suffix.label: No possible upgrade to a DoH provider.

suffix.name: AggressivePurgeTriggered
suffix.label: Aggressive purge was triggered on memory pressure.

suffix.name: InactiveOnLowEndDevice
suffix.label: Inactive areas found in low end device.

suffix.name: ModeratePurgeTriggered
suffix.label: Moderate purge was triggered on memory pressure.

suffix.name: HardRecovery
suffix.label: File is deleted in hard recovery.

suffix.name: Orphaned
suffix.label: No client associated with the file.

suffix.name: Unknown
suffix.label: No database entry associated with the file.

suffix.name: Proceed
suffix.label: The user clicked through and recovered the download.

suffix.name: Shown
suffix.label: The user was shown the prompt.

suffix.name: Main.DataSaverOff
suffix.label: Main download later dialog with data saver off.

suffix.name: Main.DataSaverOn
suffix.label: Main download later dialog with data saver on.

suffix.name: WSOrWSSScheme
suffix.label: downloads with ws or wss scheme

suffix.name: Removed
suffix.label: Captures only draw quads that have removed by draw occlusion.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2018. We'd learned enough from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.

suffix.name: Resized
suffix.label: Captures only draw quads that have changed size by draw occlusion.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2018. We'd learned enough from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.

suffix.name: Skipped
suffix.label: Captures only draw quads that are too small to apply draw occlusion.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2018. We'd learned enough from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.

suffix.name: Smaller
suffix.label: Captures only draw quads that are smaller than the layer occlusion minimum size (160x160).
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2018. We'd learned enough from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.

suffix.name: With.Complex.Transform
suffix.label: Captures only draw quads that need to go through no scale and no translation transforms.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 03/2018. We'd learned enough from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.

suffix.name: ForwardSecure
suffix.label: Packets sent at Forward Secure encryption only.

suffix.name: Handshake
suffix.label: Packets sent at Handshake encryption only.

suffix.name: Initial
suffix.label: Packets sent at Initial encryption only.

suffix.name: FadeInOverview
suffix.label: Triggered by entering overview by fading in from home

suffix.name: FadeOutOverview
suffix.label: Triggered by exiting overview by fading into home

affected-histogram.name: Apps.StateTransition.AnimationSmoothness
affected-histogram.obsolete: Removed in 2019-11. Equivalent values are tracked by Apps.HomeLauncherTransition.AnimationSmoothness.* histograms.

histogram_suffixes.name: Enterprise_ResourceCacheTiming
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 since the histogram indicators were stable.

suffix.name: Clear
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'clear' operation on a ResourceCache, which deletes all subkeys of given key.

suffix.name: Delete
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'delete' operation on a ResourceCache, which deletes given subkey.

suffix.name: FilterSubkeys
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'filterSubkeys' operation on a ResourceCache, which deletes filtered subkeys of given key.

suffix.name: Init
suffix.label: The time to perform the initialization of a ResourceCache.

suffix.name: Load
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'load' operation on a ResourceCache, which loads the content of given key.

suffix.name: LoadAllSubkeys
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'loadAllSubkeys' operation on a ResourceCache, which loads the content of all subkeys of given key.

suffix.name: PurgeOtherKeys
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'purgeOtherKeys' operation on a ResourceCache, which deletes all keys except given.

suffix.name: PurgeOtherSubkeys
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'purgeOtherSubkeys' operation on a ResourceCache, which deletes all subkeys except given.

suffix.name: Store
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'store' operation on a ResourceCache, which stores data under given key.

histogram_suffixes.name: ExpectedQueueingDurationThreshold
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed as of 08/2017. Replaced with ExpectedQueueingDurationThreshold.

suffix.name: OtherMimeType
suffix.label: A MIME type that doesn't fall into either of the other two categories.

suffix.name: ProtectedMimeType
suffix.label: A MIME type we expect CORB to protect (i.e. JSON, HTML or XML).

suffix.name: PublicMimeType
suffix.label: A MIME type we consider public (i.e. javascript or an image type).

suffix.name: ChromeNotSystem
suffix.label: Chrome is not a system installed browser.

suffix.name: ChromeSystem
suffix.label: Chrome is a system installed browser.

suffix.name: OtherDefault
suffix.label: Another browser is the default browser.

suffix.name: ConfirmInfobarTypeBlockPopups
suffix.label: Recorded for Block Popups Confirm Messages.

suffix.name: ConfirmInfobarTypeRestore
suffix.label: Recorded for Restore Tabs Confirm Messages.

suffix.name: ActivityInflated
suffix.label: The activity is ready to be drawn, although likely empty.

suffix.name: FirstFragmentInflated
suffix.label: The first fragment is ready to be drawn, the first meaningful paint. This version is buggy as it records the timestamp this event happens since the system was booted, which is not extended to measure. (http://crbug.com/1138660)
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and replaced with FirstFragmentInflatedV2 as of 10/2020.

suffix.name: FirstFragmentInflatedV2
suffix.label: The first fragment is ready to be drawn, the first meaningful paint. Version V2 fixed an issue that previous data was not recording the time duration from FRE launched.

suffix.name: TriggerLayoutInflation
suffix.label: Recorded when layout inflation is triggered.

suffix.name: WithByteSet
suffix.label: The version of the Module Integrity Verifier that uses a hash set to track relocations.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 05/2015.

suffix.name: WithoutByteSet
suffix.label: The version of the Module Integrity Verifier that doesn't use a hash set to track relocations.

suffix.name: ExistingRenderer_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation reused an existing renderer process. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: NewRenderer_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation spawned a new renderer process. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: SessionRestored
suffix.label: Navigation caused by restoring a tab from a previous session (whether from a crash or a continued session) either spawning or reusing a renderer. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.
suffix.obsolete: Replaced by SessionRestored_BeforeUnloadDiscounte. It had a misleading name as it also has the before-unload time discounted.

suffix.name: SessionRestored_BeforeUnloadDiscounted
suffix.label: Navigation caused by restoring a tab from a previous session (whether from a crash or a continued session) either spawning or reusing a renderer. Time spent in beforeunload subtracted.

suffix.name: SerializedDisplayStateSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of DisplayState in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem DisplayState in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedPostDataSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of PostData in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem PostData in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedReferrerURLSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of referrer's URL in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem referrer's URL in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedRequestHeadersSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of HTTP request headers in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem headers in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedTitleSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of title in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem title in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedURLSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of URL in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem URL in session history.

suffix.name: SerializedVirtualURLSize
suffix.label: Estimated size of virtual URL in serialized session item used to persist single NavigationItem virtual URL in session history.

suffix.name: OnDSE
suffix.label: Recorded only for pages whose URL matches the URL of the search results page of the user's default search engine.

suffix.name: OnNonDSE
suffix.label: Recorded only for pages whose URL does not match the URL of the search results page of the user's default search engine.

affected-histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time_StartWorkerExistingProcess

suffix.name: NavPreloadFirst
suffix.label: The navigation preload response arrived before the service worker finished preparing.

suffix.name: SWStartFirst
suffix.label: The service worker finished preparing before the navigation preload response arrived.

suffix.name: ExistingPageDifferentDocumentIntendedAsNew
suffix.label: existing page navigation which is intended as new

suffix.name: ExistingPageRestoredBrowserInitiated
suffix.label: existing page browser-initiated navigation which is restored

suffix.name: ExistingPageSameDocumentIntendedAsNew
suffix.label: in-document existing page navigation which is intended as new

suffix.name: ExistingPageSameDocumentRestoredBrowserInitiated
suffix.label: in-document existing page browser-initiated navigation which is restored

suffix.name: NewPageInPageOriginMismatch
suffix.label: in-document new page navigation with a non-matching origin

suffix.name: NewPageNoMatchingEntry
suffix.label: new page navigation with no matching entry

suffix.name: NewPagePendingEntryMatches
suffix.label: new page navigation which found a pending entry

suffix.name: SamePage
suffix.label: same page navigation
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated 01/2021 in favor of ExistingPageSameDocumentIntendedAsNew and ExistingPageDifferentDocumentIntendedAsNew.

histogram_suffixes.name: Net_BidirectionalStreamExperiment

suffix.name: HTTP2
suffix.label: Bidirectional stream that use HTTP2 protocol

suffix.name: QUIC
suffix.label: Bidirectional streams that use QUIC protocol

suffix.name: Insecure
suffix.label: for insecure QUIC.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from code as of 10/2015.

suffix.name: TooMany
suffix.label: for secure QUIC when there were too many rejects.

suffix.name: First21
suffix.label: Only the first group of 21 packets in a connection via

suffix.name: Some21s
suffix.label: After the first 21, this records data for some groups of 21 consecutive sequence nmubers, arriving via.

suffix.name: First6
suffix.label: Only the first group of 6 packets in a connection via

suffix.name: Some6s
suffix.label: After the first 6, this records patterns for some groups of 6 consecutive sequence numbers, arriving via.

suffix.name: Ack
suffix.label: Only packets that were received by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: IsAnAck
suffix.label: Only packets that were probably solo ACK packets when received by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: IsNotAck
suffix.label: Only packets that were probably NOT solo ACK packets when received by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: Nack
suffix.label: Only packets that were missed by Chrome as well being part of connections via

suffix.name: CONNECTION_BLUETOOTH

suffix.name: CONNECTION_ETHERNET
suffix.label: ethernet are tallied, but this may include connections to a WiFi bridge.

suffix.name: CONNECTION_WIFI
suffix.label: WiFi are tallied, but this may include connections to a mobile hotspot. Also check similar histograms that end in WIFI_802.11* for more details on some platforms.

suffix.name: CONNECTION_WIFI_ANCIENT
suffix.label: 802.11 that are no longer standard are tallied.

suffix.name: NonPacedPacket
suffix.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets were sent as rapidly as possible.

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: In this histogram results are only shown if at least two packets were ACKed in the Startup Test. Packets are sent at equal intervals. The interval is selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: Packets are sent as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.AckReceivedForNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAnAck
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got an ACK for a packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.443
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 443.

suffix.name: Sent21.6121
suffix.label: This histogram shows the difference between the time when we have received 1st byte from the server and the last time when we have received data from the server on port 6121.

suffix.name: 443.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 6121.100B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.500B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: 6121.1200B.PacketDelay
suffix.label: 1200 bytes of data is sent on port 6121.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for

suffix.name: Send6.SeriesAcked
suffix.label: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsSent
suffix.label: This histogram records how many packets (out of 21 attempted) were sent to the server via UDP.

suffix.name: 443.100B
suffix.label: 100 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.500B
suffix.label: 500 bytes of data is sent on port 443.

suffix.name: 443.1200B

suffix.name: NATBind.Sent2
suffix.label: Two packets were sent spreading over a random period, to test if the NAT dropped the binding. Afterwords, an extra (short) packet was sent with renewed NAT binding to test whether the network that was used to deliver the first packet is still connected. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least ten packets were received in the StartPacket test.

suffix.name: NonPacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: PacedPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent at equal intervals, which were selected to match the bandwidth discovered during the StartPacket test. Results are only shown in this histogram if at least two packets were received in the StartPacket Test.

suffix.name: StartPacket
suffix.label: 21 Packets were sent as rapidly as possible, just after the client successfully sent a UMA upload. Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google.

suffix.name: Bind.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the second packet never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) and the first and the extra (short) packets arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Bind.Success
suffix.label: Only when all three packets including the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Failure
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet (with renewed NAT binding) never arrived (we wait for 10 extra seconds) did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: Connectivity.Success
suffix.label: Only when the extra (short) packet arrived did we record the duration in seconds between the sendings of the first two packets in this histogram.

suffix.name: SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration (in milliseconds) between the client sending the request and the receiving of the second packet sent from the server, excluding the idle time between sendings of the first two packets. Results are only shown if the first two packets are both received.

suffix.name: First6.SeriesRecv
suffix.label: This histogram records a bit vector of the first 6 packets sent, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are received, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

suffix.name: Sent21
suffix.label: This histogram shows the number of packets received from the first

suffix.name: Sent21.GotAPacket
suffix.label: The histogram shows if we ever got at least one packet in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketDelay
suffix.label: The histogram shows the average inter-arrival time between every two consecutive packets we receive in our series of 21 multiplied by 20 (so this is essentially the time duration between the first and the last received packets).

suffix.name: Sent21.PacketsRecv
suffix.label: The histogram shows how many packets we receive in our series of 21.

suffix.name: Sent21.RecvNthPacket
suffix.label: Each packet was numbered when it was sent by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received that packet.

suffix.name: Sent21.SendToLastRecvDelay
suffix.label: This histogram records the time duration between the client sending the request and the receiving of the last packet sent from the server, excluding the total pacing time requested by the client. Results are only shown if at least two packets are received.

suffix.name: Sent21.Success.RTT
suffix.label: The histogram shows the RTT for the

suffix.name: NotUsingAccountStorage
suffix.label: The user is not using the account-scoped password storage. Either they're not signed in, or they haven't opted in to the account storage.

suffix.name: Syncing
suffix.label: The user has enabled Sync, so the account-scoped password storage is not being used.

suffix.name: UsingAccountStorage

suffix.name: SignedInAccountStoreUserSavingLocally

suffix.name: SignedInUserSavingLocally

suffix.name: SignedOutAccountStoreUser

suffix.name: SignedOutUser

suffix.label: The credential was suppressed and not auto-filled because it was a PSL-match.

suffix.name: SameOrganizationName
suffix.label: The credential was suppressed because it was for an HTTP/HTTPS origin that was neither an exact nor PSL-match to that of the observed form. Its origin had, however, the same organization-identifying name.

suffix.name: Manual
suffix.label: The password was originally typed in by the user.

suffix.name: AnyPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that matches either/both the sync password, signed-in non-syncing password, or a saved password. This is a superset of (and should be equal to or larger than) SyncPasswordEntry + SavedPasswordEntry + NonSyncPasswordEntry

suffix.name: GmailNonSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a non-syncing gaia password that is associated with a Gmail account. This is a subset of NonSyncPasswordEntry.

suffix.name: GmailSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering the sync password that is associated with a Gmail account. This is a subset of SyncPasswordEntry.

suffix.name: GSuiteNonSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a non-syncing gaia password that is associated with a GSuite account. This is a subset of NonSyncPasswordEntry. Note that GSuite non-sync password reuse detection is only triggered if configured appropriate enterprise policy.

suffix.name: GSuiteSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering the sync password that is associated with a GSuite account. This is a subset of SyncPasswordEntry. Note that GSuite sync password reuse detection is only triggered if configured appropriate enterprise policy.

suffix.name: NonGaiaEnterprisePasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that matches a non-Gaia enterprise password. Note that non-Gaia enterprise password reuse detection is only triggered if configured appropriate enterprise policy.

suffix.name: NonSyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering an unconsented primary account password.

suffix.name: PasswordFieldOnFocus
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by password field on focus event.

suffix.name: ProtectedPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a saved password that does NOT match a password that is currently signed-in. This is the same as SavedPaswordEntry.

suffix.name: SavedPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password saved in the password manager where the account is not signed-in to Google.

suffix.name: SyncPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering the sync password, which may or may not also match a saved password. (This was called SyncProtectedPasswordEntry before M62)

suffix.name: SyncProtectedPasswordEntry
suffix.label: This was renamed by SyncPasswordEntry in M62 (it was misspelled in the code) . Password protection triggered by entering the sync password, which may or may not also match a saved password.

suffix.name: UnknownNonPrimaryPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that does not match a primary account password but no current signed-in account is found.

suffix.name: UnknownPrimaryPasswordEntry
suffix.label: Password protection triggered by entering a password that matches a primary account password but no current signed-in account is found.

suffix.name: LowReputation
suffix.label: Password protection reponse with low reputation verdict

suffix.name: Phishing
suffix.label: Password protection response with phishing verdict

suffix.name: Safe
suffix.label: Password protection response with safe verdict

suffix.name: FromHttpRealm
suffix.label: The account in question was saved on an HTTP site.

suffix.name: FromHttpsRealm
suffix.label: The account in question was saved on a HTTPS site (including those with certificate issues).

suffix.name: OnAnyRealmWithDifferentHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have different hosts than the account in question, and their scheme is either HTTP or HTTPS.

suffix.name: OnHttpRealmWithDifferentHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTP scheme and different hosts than the account in question.

suffix.name: OnHttpRealmWithSameHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTP scheme and the same host as the account in question.

suffix.name: OnHttpsRealmWithDifferentHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTPS scheme and different hosts than the account in question.

suffix.name: OnHttpsRealmWithSameHost
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms have HTTPS scheme and the same host as the account in question.

suffix.name: OnPSLMatchingRealm
suffix.label: The number of other accounts whose realms are public suffix matches to that of the account in question (the scheme is always the same in these cases).

suffix.name: Android
suffix.label: The password is for an Android app.

suffix.name: Ftp
suffix.label: The scheme of the origin is FTP.

suffix.name: Http
suffix.label: The scheme of the origin is HTTP.

suffix.name: Https
suffix.label: The scheme of the origin is HTTPS.

suffix.name: Other
suffix.label: The scheme of the origin is something else.

suffix.name: InsecureOrigin
suffix.label: The recording took place on an insecure origin.

suffix.name: MixedForm
suffix.label: The recording took place on a secure origin, but the form action was an insecure origin.

suffix.name: SecureOrigin
suffix.label: The recording took place on a secure origin.

suffix.name: BasicCard
suffix.label: Request is completed using basic card method.

suffix.name: Google
suffix.label: Request is completed using Google payment instrument.

suffix.name: Other
suffix.label: Request is completed using other payment instruments.

suffix.name: PlayBilling
suffix.label: Request is completed using Google Play Billing instrument.

suffix.name: SecurePaymentConfirmation
suffix.label: Request is completed using secure payment confirmation instrument.

suffix.name: OtherAborted
suffix.label: The Payment Request was aborted but not but the user

suffix.name: UserAborted
suffix.label: The Payment Request was aborted by the user

suffix.label: prerender is enabled, and the TTL is extended to 5 minutes.

suffix.name: PrerenderMatchComplete
suffix.label: prerender is enabled, and match complete replacements are used to gather extended statistics.

suffix.label: prerender is enabled with multiple simultanious prerenders.

suffix.label: prerender is enabled, but pages are not swapped in.

suffix.label: Prefetch too old to skip revalidation.

suffix.name: Reference
suffix.label: No prefetch. Warning: do not compare with the load times of prefetched pages (bias).

suffix.name: Visible

suffix.name: none

suffix.label: Link triggered prerender, rel=prerender, cross domain.

suffix.name: CachedServerConfig

suffix.label: This metric is for only oop raster.

suffix.label: This metric is for current network only.

suffix.name: OtherNetworks
suffix.label: This metric is for old networks or networks to be migrated to only.

histogram_suffixes.name: RecurrenceRankerModel

suffix.name: SameOrigin
suffix.label: Same-origin requests (relative to the initiator, if present, and otherwise the initial referrer URL).

suffix.name: Fast
suffix.label: Fast start by skipping normal chrome.dll startup.

suffix.name: Duration0To100MilliSec
suffix.label: remoting sessions have duration in (0, 0.1] seconds

suffix.name: Duration1To3Sec
suffix.label: remoting sessions have duration in (1, 3] seconds

suffix.name: Duration3To5Sec
suffix.label: remoting sessions have duration in (3, 5] seconds

suffix.name: Duration5To10Sec
suffix.label: remoting sessions have duration in (5, 10] seconds

suffix.name: Duration10To15Sec
suffix.label: remoting sessions have duration in (10, 15] seconds

suffix.name: Duration100MilliSecTo1Sec
suffix.label: remoting sessions have duration in (0.1, 1] seconds

suffix.name: Char
suffix.label: The Char event occurs on textual keyboard input.

suffix.name: GestureDoubleTap
suffix.label: A GestureDoubleTap occurs when the user double taps on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureFlingCancel
suffix.label: A GestureFlingCancel is sent to the renderer to cancel any active flings.

suffix.name: GestureFlingStart
suffix.label: A GestureFlingStart is sent when the user quickly flicks on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureLongPress
suffix.label: A GestureLongPress is sent when the user taps down and holds their finger on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureLongTap
suffix.label: A GestureLongTap is sent when the user taps down on a touchscreen, holds their finger for a while, then releases.

suffix.name: GesturePinchBegin
suffix.label: A GesturePinchBegin is sent when a user starts a pinch zoom motion on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GesturePinchEnd
suffix.label: A GesturePinchEnd is sent when the user releases their fingers from the touchscreen after performing a pinch zoom motion.

suffix.name: GesturePinchUpdate
suffix.label: GesturePinchUpdate events are sent while the user is performing a pinch zoom motion on a touch screen. GesturePinchUpdate events are sent as the user changes the distance between their fingers.

suffix.name: GestureScrollBegin
suffix.label: A GestureScrollBegin is sent at the beginning of a gesture scroll on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureScrollEnd
suffix.label: A GestureScrollEnd is sent when the user releases their finger after a gesture scroll on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureScrollUpdate
suffix.label: GestureScrollUpdate events are sent as the user drags their finger along the touchscreen during a gesture scroll.

suffix.name: GestureScrollUpdateWithoutPropagation
suffix.label: GestureScrollUpdateWithoutPropagation events are scroll updates that shouldn't bubble, generated by a gesture fling.

suffix.name: GestureShowPress
suffix.label: A GestureShowPress event is sent when the user presses down on the touchscreen but before a GestureTapDown.

suffix.name: GestureTap
suffix.label: A GestureTap is sent when the user presses down and releases on a touchscreen.

suffix.name: GestureTapCancel
suffix.label: A GestureTapCancel is sent to cancel a pending GestureTap event. For example, if the user taps down but drags their finger instead of releasing it.

suffix.name: GestureTapDown
suffix.label: A GestureTapDown is sent when the user presses on the touchscreen in what could potentially be a full GestureTap event.

suffix.name: GestureTapUnconfirmed
suffix.label: A GestureTapUnconfirmed is sent when the user taps the touchscreen but, due to a delay, the GestureTap isn't sent yet.

suffix.name: GestureTwoFingerTap
suffix.label: A GestureTwoFingerTap is sent when the user presses down a releases on a touchscreen with two fingers.

suffix.name: KeyDown
suffix.label: A KeyDown event is sent when a keyboard key is pressed down.

suffix.name: KeyUp
suffix.label: A KeyUp event is sent when a depressed keyboard key is released.

suffix.name: MouseDown
suffix.label: A MouseDown event is sent when the user click down a mouse button.

suffix.name: MouseEnter
suffix.label: A MouseEnter event is sent when the mouse cursor enters the renderer area.

suffix.name: MouseLeave
suffix.label: A MouseLeave event is sent when the mouse cursor leaves the renderer area.

suffix.name: MouseMove
suffix.label: A MouseMove event is sent when the mouse cursor moves within the renderer area.

suffix.name: MouseUp
suffix.label: A MouseUp event is sent when a depressed mouse button is released.

suffix.name: MouseWheel
suffix.label: A MouseWheel event is sent when the user scrolls using the mouse wheel within the renderer area.

suffix.name: RawKeyDown
suffix.label: A RawKeyDown event is a wrapper around a native key event.

suffix.name: TouchCancel
suffix.label: A TouchCancel is used to cancel an existing touch point. For example, if the user drags a finger outside the bounds of the renderer.

suffix.name: TouchEnd
suffix.label: A TouchEnd is send when the user lifts a finger from the touchscreen.

suffix.name: TouchMove
suffix.label: A TouchMove is sent when the user moves a finger along the touchscreen.

suffix.name: TouchStart
suffix.label: A TouchStart is sent when the user first touches a finger to the touchscreen.

suffix.name: NonDiscardableTotalAllocated
suffix.label: Summed over the PartitionAlloc, malloc, mainThreadIsolate() and BlinkGC allocators

suffix.name: TotalAllocated
suffix.label: Summed over the PartitionAlloc, malloc, discardable memory, mainThreadIsolate() and BlinkGC allocators

suffix.name: TotalAllocatedPerRenderView
suffix.label: TotalAllocated divided by the number of RenderViews

suffix.name: V8MainThreadIsolate
suffix.label: Constrained to memory usage by mainThreadIsolate()

suffix.name: DidFinishLoad
suffix.label: Recorded each time DidFinishLoad is called for *any* frame within the page.

suffix.name: MainFrame.PeakDuringLoad
suffix.label: In the main frame, polled each time CreateURLLoader is called, and the maximum value is recorded when DidFinishLoad is called.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2018. No longer recorded.

suffix.name: MainFrameDidFinishLoad
suffix.label: Recorded when DidFinishLoad is called for the main frame.

suffix.name: PeakDuringLoad
suffix.label: Polled each time CreateURLLoader is called, and the maximum value is recorded when DidFinishLoad is called.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2018. No longer recorded.

suffix.name: ServiceWorkerControlledMainFrame.PeakDuringLoad
suffix.label: In the main frame which is controlled by a service worker, polled each time CreateURLLoader is called, and the maximum value is recorded when DidFinishLoad is called.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 04/2018. No longer recorded.

suffix.name: ServiceWorkerControlledMainFrameDidFinishLoad
suffix.label: Recorded when DidFinishLoad is called for the main frame which is controlled by a service worker.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of June 2018. No longer recorded. This was also being recorded when the page had a controller with no fetch event, which usually means the service worker was not running.

suffix.name: Background.AfterFifthMinute

suffix.name: Background.AfterTenthMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular task type starting from the eleventh minute after backgrounding the renderer. The renderer is expected to be mostly idle during this period.

suffix.name: CrossOriginHidden
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from cross-origin offscreen frames.

suffix.name: CrossOriginVisible
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from cross-origin onscreen frames.

suffix.name: MainFrameBackground
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from backgrounded main frames.

suffix.name: MainFrameHidden
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from offscreen main frames.

suffix.name: MainFrameVisible
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from onscreen main frames.

suffix.name: Other

suffix.name: SameOriginBackground
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from same-origin backgrounded frames.

suffix.name: SameOriginHidden
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from same-origin offscreen frames.

suffix.name: SameOriginVisible
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from same-origin onscreen frames.

suffix.name: Compositor
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from the compositor task queue.

suffix.name: Default

suffix.name: DefaultLoading
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from the default loading task queue.

suffix.name: FrameLoading
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from the frame loading task queue.

suffix.name: FramePausable
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from the frame pausable task queue.

suffix.name: FrameThrottleable
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from the frame throttleable task queue.

suffix.name: Other
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from events in any other task queue.

suffix.name: Unthrottled
suffix.label: Expected Queueing Time from the unthrottled task queue.

suffix.name: Hidden
suffix.label: The frame is hidden when the task starts running.

suffix.name: Visible
suffix.label: The frame is visible when the task starts running.

suffix.name: Background
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is backgrounded. This does not include extension renderers.

suffix.name: Background.AfterFifthMinute
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is backgrounded for longer than five minutes. This does not include extension renderers.

suffix.name: Background.AfterFirstMinute
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is backgrounded for longer than one minute. Most of loading tasks are expected to complete by then. This does not include extension renderers.

suffix.name: Background.AfterTenthMinute
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is backgrounded for longer than ten minutes. This does not include extension renderers.

suffix.name: Extension.Background
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is backgrounded. This only includes extension renderers.

suffix.name: Extension.Foreground
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is foregrounded. This only includes extension renderers.

suffix.name: Foreground
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is foregrounded. This does not include extension renderers.

suffix.name: Foreground.AfterFirstMinute
suffix.label: Main thread load when the renderer is foregrounded for longer than one minute. Most of loading tasks are expected to complete by then. This does not include extension renderers.

suffix.name: Background
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type when the renderer is in the background.

suffix.name: Background.AfterFifthMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type starting from the sixth minute after backgrounding the renderer. The renderer is expected to be mostly idle during this period.

suffix.name: Background.AfterTenthMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular type starting from the eleventh minute after backgrounding the renderer. The renderer is expected to be mostly idle during this period.

suffix.name: Background.FifthMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the fifth minute after backgrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Background.FirstMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the first minute after backgrounding the renderer. A large amount of loading tasks are expected during this period.

suffix.name: Background.FourthMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the fourth minute after backgrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Background.KeepAlive.AfterFifthMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type starting from the sixth minute after backgrounding the renderer when keep-alive signal is present.

suffix.name: Background.KeepAlive.AfterTenthMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type starting from the eleventh minute after backgrounding the renderer when keep-alive signal is present.

suffix.name: Background.SecondMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the second minute after backgrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Background.ThirdMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the third minute after backgrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Foreground
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type when the renderer is in the foreground. Please note that individual tabs in this renderer can be backgrounded.

suffix.name: Foreground.AfterThirdMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type starting from the fourth minute after foregrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Foreground.FirstMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the first minute after foregrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Foreground.SecondMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the second minute after foregrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Foreground.ThirdMinute
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type during the third minute after foregrounding the renderer.

suffix.name: Hidden

suffix.name: HiddenMusic
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type when the renderer is hidden and is playing audible sound.

suffix.name: Visible
suffix.label: Time spent in tasks of a particular queue type when the renderer is visible.

suffix.name: NonDelayable

suffix.label: All in-flight requests issued by all resource scheduler clients were counted.

suffix.name: GlobalDelayable
suffix.label: Delayable in-flight requests issued by all resource scheduler clients were counted.

suffix.name: GlobalLayoutBlocking
suffix.label: Layout blocking in-flight requests issued by all resource scheduler clients were counted.

suffix.name: GlobalNonDelayable
suffix.label: Non-delayable in-flight requests issued by all resource scheduler clients were counted.

suffix.name: TotalLayoutBlocking
suffix.label: Layout blocking requests in-flight were counted.

suffix.name: Checked

suffix.label: Resources that were checked and deemed safe. Logged when the URL check is completed.

suffix.label: Resources that were not checked because they are not active-ish content types. Only used on mobile. Logged before the resource request starts.

suffix.name: Tracked
suffix.label: Total duration of all tasks managed by the scheduler. This histogram is similar to the plain .CPUTimePerThread, but it ensures that the number of samples matches the .Untracked version of the same histogram.

suffix.name: Untracked
suffix.label: Total execution time unaccounted for by the scheduler. Calculated as the difference between total thread time and the sum of all tasks managed by the scheduler.

suffix.label: The time to perform the 'keys' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which returns all of the keys in the cache.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 02/2019. Replaced by ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.Renderer.Keys.

suffix.name: Match
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 08/2018. Replaced by ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.Match2 in order to use a larger maximum value.

suffix.name: Match2
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'match' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a lookup.

suffix.name: MatchAll
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 08/2018. Replaced by ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.MatchAll2 in order to use a larger maximum value.

suffix.name: MatchAll2
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'matchAll' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a mass cache lookup.

suffix.name: Put
suffix.label: The time to perform 'put' operations on a ServiceWorker Cache, which writes new entries into the cache. This includes both put() method calls and the storage write operation performed by add()/addAll() method calls.
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 02/2019. Replaced by ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.Renderer.PutOne and ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.Renderer.PutMany.

histogram_suffixes.name: ServiceWorkerCache_Cache_Delete
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2019. Not replaced with any new histogram.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchDisabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'delete' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which deletes matching entries in the cache, when the ignoreSearch option is set to false.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchEnabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'delete' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which deletes matching entries in the cache, when the ignoreSearch option is set to true.

histogram_suffixes.name: ServiceWorkerCache_Cache_Keys2
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2019. Not replaced with any new histogram.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchDisabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'keys' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which returns all matching keys in the cache, when the ignoreSearch option is set to false.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchEnabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'keys' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which returns all matching keys in the cache, when the ignoreSearch option is set to true.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchDisabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'match' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a lookup, when the ignoreSearch option is set to false.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchEnabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'match' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a lookup, when the ignoreSearch option is set to true.

histogram_suffixes.name: ServiceWorkerCache_Cache_MatchAll2
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2019. Not replaced with any new histogram.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchDisabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'matchAll' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a mass cache lookup, when the ignoreSearch option is set to true.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchEnabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'matchAll' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a mass cache lookup, when the ignoreSearch option is set to true.

suffix.name: Hit
suffix.label: The time to perform a 'match' operation on a given Cache that successfully results in a Response.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearch
suffix.label: The time to perform a 'match' operation on a given Cache with the 'ignoreSearch' option set. This includes measurements for hits, misses, and errors.

suffix.name: Miss
suffix.label: The time to perform a 'match' operation on a given Cache that completes successfully, but does not find a matching entry.

suffix.name: DeleteOne
suffix.label: The time to delete a single Request/Response entry from a Cache. This measurement includes times for both existing or non-existant entries.

suffix.name: Keys
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'keys' operation on a given Cache. This includes measurements for both invocations targeting all entries or only entries for a specific request parameter.

suffix.name: Match
suffix.label: The time to perform a 'match' operation on a given Cache. This includes measurements for all invocations, including hits, misses, errors, etc.

suffix.name: MatchAll
suffix.label: The time to perform a 'matchAll' operation on a given Cache. This includes measurements for all invocations, including hits, misses, and errors. In addition requests for all Cache entries and for specific request params are included together in this histogram.

suffix.name: PutMany
suffix.label: The time to put a multiple Request/Response entries into a given Cache. This may or may not include deleting existing entries that match any of the Requests. This includes measurements for both successes and failures.

suffix.name: PutOne
suffix.label: The time to put a single Request/Response entry into a given Cache. This may or may not include deleting an existing entry matching the Request. This includes measurements for both successes and failures.

suffix.name: Delete
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'delete' operation on a ServiceWorker CacheStorage, which deletes a cache.

suffix.name: Has
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'has' operation on a ServiceWorker CacheStorage, which returns if the cache exists.

suffix.name: Keys
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'keys' operation on a ServiceWorker CacheStorage, which returns all of the cache names.

suffix.name: Match
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 08/2018. Replaced by ServiceWorkerCache.CacheStorage.Match2 in order to use a larger maximum value.

suffix.name: Match2
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'match' operation on a ServiceWorker CacheStorage, which does a shortcut cache lookup.

suffix.name: Open
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'open' operation on a ServiceWorker CacheStorage, which gets or creates a cache.

histogram_suffixes.name: ServiceWorkerCache_CacheStorage_Match2
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2019. Not replaced with any new histogram.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchDisabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'match' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a shortcut cache lookup, when the ignoreSearch option is set to false.

suffix.name: IgnoreSearchEnabled
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'match' operation on a ServiceWorker Cache, which does a shortcut cache lookup, when the ignoreSearch option is set to true.

suffix.name: Delete
suffix.label: The time to 'delete' a Cache from the origin's CacheStorage. If the Cache is still in use then the actual deletion may be deferred until the last reference is dropped. Additional time due to deferral is not included in this measurement.

suffix.name: Has
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'has' operation on the origin's CacheStorage.

suffix.name: Keys
suffix.label: The time to perform the 'keys' operation on the origin's CacheStorage.

suffix.name: MatchAllCaches
suffix.label: The time to perform a 'match' operation against all caches associated with the origin's CacheStorage. This histogram includes measurements for hits, misses, and errors.

suffix.name: MatchOneCache
suffix.label: The time to perform a 'match' operation against a single cache associated with the origin's CacheStorage. This histogram includes measurements for hits, misses, and errors.

suffix.name: Open
suffix.label: The time to 'open' a Cache in the origin's CacheStorage. Some opening operations may happen asynchronously after the 'open' returns a Cache object. That deferred asynchronous work is not included in this measurement.

suffix.name: Browser
suffix.label: Measurements taken in the browser process on the IO thread.

suffix.name: Renderer
suffix.label: Measurements taken in the renderer process on the javascript thread.

suffix.name: docs
suffix.label: Custom histogram for Google Docs and Drive

suffix.name: ntp
suffix.label: Custom histogram for New Tab Page

suffix.name: WorkerStartOccurred
suffix.label: The worker was not already running. Worker startup occurred.

suffix.name: MemoryPressure

suffix.name: MemoryPressure_Loaded
suffix.label: Tabs fully loaded before memory pressure.

suffix.name: MemoryPressure_LoadStarted
suffix.label: Tabs started to load before memory pressure.

suffix.name: NoMemoryPressure
suffix.label: Total tabs involved in a session restore that did not encounter memory pressure.

suffix.name: NoMemoryPressure_Loaded
suffix.label: Tabs fully loaded in a session restore that did not encounter memory pressure.

suffix.name: NoMemoryPressure_LoadStarted
suffix.label: Tabs started to load in a session restore that did not encounter memory pressure.

suffix.name: InvalidVersion
suffix.label: After an invalid version was read.

suffix.name: ReadNextMapIdError
suffix.label: After reading the map id failed.

suffix.name: ReadVersionError
suffix.label: After reading the schema version failed.

suffix.name: ShowInputOptionsOnShelf
suffix.label: Show input options in the shelf

suffix.name: Translate

suffix.name: DefaultSearch

suffix.name: Failure

suffix.name: SubsequentRun

suffix.name: NewAccount

suffix.name: NewAccountExistingAccount
suffix.label: Using a new account, in the sign-in promo, while Chrome knows about other accounts.

suffix.name: NewAccountNoExistingAccount

suffix.name: NewAccountPreDice

suffix.name: NotDefault
suffix.label: Using not the default account, in the sign-in promo.

suffix.name: WithDefault
suffix.label: Using the default account, in the sign-in promo.

suffix.name: NoSync
suffix.label: User has not opted in to Sync.

suffix.name: Sync
suffix.label: User has opted in to Sync.

suffix.name: FirstRequest
suffix.label: First identity request since the application start.

suffix.name: FirstRequestForeground
suffix.label: First identity request after coming back to foreground.

suffix.name: ForegroundRequest
suffix.label: Request fetched in foreground. Excludes the first request in the current foreground session.

suffix.name: NotPopulated
suffix.label: The SSOAuth identity list is not populated.

suffix.name: Stale
suffix.label: The SSOAuth identity list is stale.

suffix.name: Valid
suffix.label: The SSOAuth identity list is valid.

suffix.name: WithIndex
suffix.label: The Simple Cache index was loaded.

suffix.name: WithoutIndex
suffix.label: The Simple Cache index was not yet loaded.

suffix.name: CompositorThread

suffix.name: MainThread
suffix.label: The throughput of the main thread

suffix.name: ScrollingThread
suffix.label: The throughput of the thread responsible for handling the thread

suffix.name: SlowerThread
suffix.label: The worse throughput of the main and the compositor thread

suffix.name: SSLforHTTPSProxy

suffix.name: SSLForProxies
suffix.label: SSLClientSocket wrapping the TCPClient socket eventually used for connection to a proxy

suffix.name: TCP
suffix.label: plain, no proxy, no SSL socket

suffix.name: TCPforHTTPProxy
suffix.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to an HTTP proxy

suffix.name: TCPforHTTPSProxy
suffix.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to an HTTPS proxy

suffix.name: TCPforSOCKS
suffix.label: TCPClientSocket eventually used for connection to a SOCKS proxy

suffix.name: cwndMin10
suffix.label: using dynamic cwnd policy no lower than 10

suffix.name: cwndMin16
suffix.label: using dynamic cwnd policy no lower than 16

suffix.name: npn_with_http
suffix.label: with NPN negotiated but using HTTP instead of SPDY

suffix.name: npn_with_spdy
suffix.label: with NPN negotiated and using SPDY

suffix.name: Both
suffix.label: This variation counts the number of locales that are supported by both Hunspell and the OS spell checker.

suffix.name: HunspellOnly
suffix.label: This variation counts the number of locales that are only supported by Hunspell.

suffix.name: NativeOnly
suffix.label: This variation counts the number of locales that are only supported by the OS spell checker.

suffix.name: NoSupport
suffix.label: This variation counts the number of locales that are not supported by either Hunspell or the OS spell checker.

suffix.name: HunspellOnly
suffix.label: This variation measures the duration when only Hunspell is used.

suffix.name: Hybrid
suffix.label: This variation measures the duration when Hunspell is used for some locales and the OS spell checker is used for others.

suffix.name: NativeOnly
suffix.label: This variation measures the duration when only by the OS spell checker is used.

histogram_suffixes.name: StartupProfilingAbandonState
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed 10/2019. Since Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad2 is no longer tracked, the non-suffixed reason is always for Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2 and the suffix does not provide additional information.

suffix.name: NoLoad
suffix.label: Abandoned before first main frame load.

suffix.name: ColdStartup
suffix.label: Startup was cold (mostly hard faults). Threshold updated Jan 2020, metrics expected to bump.

suffix.name: LukewarmStartup
suffix.label: Startup was neither warm nor cold.
suffix.obsolete: Obsolete as of Jan 2020. Was a diagnosis metric when warm/cold distributions didn't look as expected but recording the suffix for every startup metric was deemed overkill. Use Startup.Temperature and Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartHardFaultCount to diagnose discrepancies.

suffix.name: WarmStartup
suffix.label: Startup was warm (almost no hard faults).

suffix.name: ThreadNowDuration
suffix.label: Duration is in thread CPU time.

suffix.name: StartWorkerExistingProcess
suffix.label: The worker started up in an existing process

suffix.name: StartWorkerExistingProcess
suffix.label: The worker started up in an existing process

histogram_suffixes.name: Storage_BlobAppendableItems
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed on 12/18. Metric wasn't used for anything and wasn't useful.

suffix.name: File
suffix.label: Appending a file with a known size.

suffix.name: FileSystem
suffix.label: Appending a filesystem object with known size.

suffix.name: OnMemoryPressure
suffix.label: Eviction was triggered because of memory pressure signal.

suffix.name: SizeExceededInMemoryLimit
suffix.label: Eviction was triggered because the total size exceeded maximum in memory size allwed

suffix.name: SizeExceededMaxDiskSpace
suffix.label: Eviction was triggered because the total size exceeded maximum available disk space

suffix.name: ConnectionOpened
suffix.label: Scanning is interrupted by an new connection to the database.

suffix.name: ForceClose
suffix.label: Scanning is stopped by force closing.

suffix.name: MaxIterations
suffix.label: Scanning is stopped because the maximum record iteration count was hit.

suffix.name: SweepError
suffix.label: Scanning is stopped because a leveldb error was encountered during sweeping.

suffix.name: TimeoutReached
suffix.label: Scanning is stopped by the timeout.

suffix.name: UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR
suffix.label: When configuration encounters an unrecoverable error

suffix.name: RECENTLY_CLOSED_TABS
suffix.label: Request made by the recently closed tabs menu.

suffix.name: UNKNOWN
suffix.label: Request made by an unknown source.

suffix.name: WIFI_CREDENTIAL
suffix.label: WIFI_CREDENTIAL
suffix.obsolete: This never got launched and is removed.

suffix.name: WifiCredentials
suffix.label: Wifi credentials
suffix.obsolete: This never got launched and is removed.

suffix.name: CannotGenerateStorageKey
suffix.label: The bridge cannot generate a valid storage key based on the entity data.

suffix.name: DecryptionPending
suffix.label: Decryption keys are missing at the moment (it is queued for later decryption which may or may not happen).

suffix.name: DecryptionPendingForTooLong
suffix.label: Decryption keys were missing for so long that the update was ignored.

suffix.name: FailedToDecrypt
suffix.label: Decryption is not successful (maybe the data is corrupt).

suffix.name: InconsistentClientTag
suffix.label: Client tag hash from the server does not match the one computed by the bridge based on the entity data.

suffix.name: TombstoneForNonexistentInIncrementalUpdate
suffix.label: It was a tombstone for an entity that does not exist locally.

suffix.name: TombstoneInFullUpdate
suffix.label: It was a tombstone in a full update.

suffix.name: GetData
suffix.label: This happens as a result of missing data in response from GetData() call.

suffix.name: ModelReadyToSync
suffix.label: This happens as a result of a ModelReadyToSync() call with metadata batch containing entities with duplicate client-tag-hashes (which indicates that all but one from each equivalence class are previous orphans). The type of the orphan is reported in this histogram, one for each orphan.

suffix.name: Put
suffix.label: This happens as a result of a Put() call with an entity whose client-tag-hash is already tracked by the processor (which indicates an orphan).

suffix.name: TransitionToCollapsed
suffix.label: Transition to the collapsed system tray

suffix.name: TransitionToExpanded
suffix.label: Transition to the expanded system tray

suffix.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2019. Merged with UserVisibleTaskPriority, because both histograms effectively record the same thing since we merged pools.

suffix.name: Background
suffix.label: Applies to the Background priority worker group.

suffix.name: Foreground
suffix.label: Applies to the Foreground priority worker group.

suffix.name: CACHE
suffix.label: where watched thread is CACHE BrowserThread.

suffix.name: DB
suffix.label: where watched thread is DB BrowserThread.

suffix.name: FILE
suffix.label: where watched thread is FILE BrowserThread.

suffix.name: IO
suffix.label: where watched thread is IO BrowserThread.

suffix.name: UI
suffix.label: where watched thread is UI BrowserThread.

suffix.name: TabHidden
suffix.label: Triggered by the tab being hidden.

suffix.name: NTP
suffix.label: Query tiles section on the new tab page

histogram_suffixes.name: TimestampTimebaseProcess
histogram_suffixes.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2017 in Issue 650338. Using a DCHECK instead.

suffix.name: NotQuic
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 08/2015. Use Net.HttpJob.*Secure.NotQuic instead.

suffix.name: Quic
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 08/2015. Use Net.HttpJob.*Secure.Quic instead.

suffix.name: Secure.NotQuic
suffix.obsolete: Deprecated as of 08/2018. No longer used.

suffix.name: Secure.Quic
suffix.label: Recorded for Google servers (https) only when QUIC is used.

suffix.name: FromRegistry
suffix.label: Validation using MACs in the Windows Registry.

suffix.name: ToFillPassword
suffix.label: The reauth happened to fill an account-stored password.

suffix.name: ToGeneratePassword
suffix.label: The reauth happened to trigger the password generation.

suffix.name: ToManageInSettings
suffix.label: The reauth happened to manage account-stored passwords in settings.

suffix.name: ToMovePassword
suffix.label: The reauth happened to move a password to the account store.

suffix.name: ToSaveOrUpdatePassword
suffix.label: The reauth happened to save a password to the account store.

suffix.name: Failure
suffix.label: The operation or partial operation failed: for ServerTime, this means that the subsequent Finalize part failed; for TotalTime, it means that the operation failed during Finalize.

suffix.name: Success
suffix.label: The operation or partial operation succeeded.

suffix.name: Signing
suffix.label: SRR attachment and outgoing request signing

suffix.name: UncompressedChromeArchive
suffix.label: uncompressed archive: chrome.7z holding install dir (big).

affected-histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilFirstSoftTrigger
affected-histogram.obsolete: Deprecated as of July 2017, in favor of NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilFirstShownTrigger and NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilFirstStartupTrigger.

suffix.name: docs
suffix.label: Custom histogram for Google Docs and Drive

suffix.name: top10
suffix.label: Custom histogram for Alexa's Top10 non-Google sites

suffix.name: asm
suffix.label: This histogram contains results for asm.js.

suffix.name: wasm
suffix.label: This histogram contains results for wasm modules.

suffix.name: Destroy
suffix.label: Destroy DB
suffix.obsolete: Removed in favor of [LoadKeys, Clear] as of 2020-04-03.

suffix.name: LoadKeys
suffix.label: Load all DB keys
suffix.obsolete: Removed in favor of [Clear] as of 2020-04-24.

suffix.name: Read
suffix.label: Read an entry from the DB

suffix.name: Write
suffix.label: Write an entry to the DB

suffix.name: AllVR
suffix.label: Entered either VR Browsing or WebVR mode.

suffix.name: WebVRPresentation
suffix.label: Entered WebVR presentation mode (also includes splash screen).

suffix.name: VrBrowser
suffix.label: FRE not complete when starting Chrome

suffix.name: WebVRAutopresent
suffix.label: FRE not complete when starting WebVR auto-presentation

suffix.name: Unknown
suffix.label: GVR version used with an unknown headset.

suffix.name: GVR
suffix.label: The GVR version being used for VR. Special values: (-4) Could not encode GVR version; (-3) Device does not support VR; (-2) GVR is not installed; (-1) GVR is installed but version is too old to be logged.

suffix.name: Browser
suffix.label: The session is restricted to the period that the browser is displaying a regular page.

suffix.name: Fullscreen
suffix.label: The session is restricted to the period that the browser is displaying fullscreen content.

suffix.name: WebVR
suffix.label: The session is restricted to the period that browser is displaying WebVR contents.

suffix.name: InTab
suffix.label: Happened in app running as a tab

suffix.name: InWindow
suffix.label: Happened in app running as a window

suffix.name: MoreThanThreeUserInstalledApps
suffix.label: Happenned in web site for user with 4 or more user-installed apps

suffix.name: NoUserInstalledApps
suffix.label: Happenned in web site for user without user-installed apps

suffix.name: UpToThreeUserInstalledApps
suffix.label: Happenned in web site for user with [1-3] user-installed apps

suffix.name: UserInstalled.FromCreateShortcutButton
suffix.label: Happened in user-installed app created via the Create Shortcut button

suffix.name: UserInstalled.FromInstallButton
suffix.label: Happened in user-installed app created via the Install button

affected-histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2020. The affected histogram is deprecated.

affected-histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 11/2020. The affected histogram is deprecated.
